name: Yochai Benkler
position: Berkman Professor of Entrepreneurial Legal Studies at Harvard Law School
about_speaker: Benkler studies commons-based peer production, and published his seminal book, The Wealth of Networks in 2006

name: SohYeong Noh
position: Director of Art Centre Nabi and a board member of CC Korea
about_speaker: As the main venue for new media art production in Korea, Nabi promotes cross-disciplinary collaboration and understanding among science technology, humanities, and the arts.

name: Kilnam Chon
position: Berkman Professor of Entrepreneurial Legal Studies at Harvard Law School
about_speaker: Kilnam Chon helped bring the internet to Asia and is an outspoken advocate for the open web and digital com-mons. In 2012. he was inducted into the inaugural class of the Internet Society’s (ISOC) Internet Hall of Fame

name: Julia Leda
position: President of Young Pirates of Europe
about_speaker: European ingetration, political democracy and participation of youth through online as her major condern, Reda’s report outlining potential changes to EU copyright law was approved by the Parliament in July

name: Ryan Merkley
position: CEO of Creativve Commons, ex COO of the Mozilla Foundation
about_speaker: Ryan had been leading open-source projects at the Mozilla Foundation such as the open-source move-ment

name: Lila tretikov
position: Executive Director of the Wikimedia Foundation
about_speaker: Lila Tretikov is the Executive of the Wikimedia Foundation, the nonprofit organization that operates Wikipedia. Wikipedia is freely available in 290 languag-es and used by nearly half a billion people around the world every month.
